\usepackage{amsmath}
\usepackage{amssymb}

\makeatletter

\usepackage{amsmath}

\makeatother

\begin{document}

\section{BPR}

\[
P=\frac{\left|S\cap\left(\bigcup\limits_{i=1}^{M}G_{i}\right)\right|}{|S|}
\]
\[
R=\frac{{\sum\limits_{i=1}^{M}\left|S\cap G_{i}\right|}}{\sum\limits_{i=1}^{M}\left|G_{i}\right|}
\]
\[
F=\frac{2PR}{P+R}
\]


where $S$ and $\{G_{i}\}_{i=1}^{M}$ are boundary maps and $\cap$
does a bipartite graph assignment between them.


\section{RI (Rand Index)}


\subsection{RI}

between two segmentations

\[
RI(S,G)=\frac{1}{T}\sum\limits_{j<k}\left[\mathbb{I}\left(S(j)=S(k)\wedge G(j)=G(k)\right)+\mathbb{I}\left(S(j)\neq S(k)\wedge G(j)\neq G(k)\right)\right]
\]


where $\mathbb{I}$ is the identity function,

$S(j)$ is the label of pixel $j$ in the segmentation $S$,

$N=\left|S\right|=\left|G\right|$ is number of pixels in the image
(and each segmentation), and 

$T=\left(\frac{N}{2}\right)$ is the number of possible unique pairs
among $N$ pixels.


\subsection{RSRI (Random Subsample RI)}

previously CPD (Crude Patch Distance), which was a misnomer

between two segmentations


\subsection{PRI (Probabilistic RI)}

between a test segmentation and multiple ground truths

\[
PRI(S,\{G_{i}\}_{i=1}^{M})=\frac{1}{T}\sum\limits_{j<k}\left[c_{jk}p_{jk}+\left(1-c_{jk}\right)\left(1-p_{jk}\right)\right]
\]


where $c_{jk}=\mathbb{I}\left(S(j)=S(k)\right)$ - the event of the
pair of pixels $j$ and $k$ having the same label in segmentation
$S$, and

$p_{jk}$ - probability of $c_{jk}$.


\section{SC (Segmentation Covering)}


\subsection{Overlap}

Overlap of two regions $s$ and $g$

\[
\mathcal{O}\left(s,g\right)=\frac{\left|s\cap g\right|}{\left|s\cup g\right|}
\]



\subsection{IoU (intersection over Union), a.k.a. Jaccard Index}

How to normalise it in the case of two segmentations $S=\left\{{s_{i}}\right\}_{i=1}^{p}$
and $G=\left\{{g_{j}}\right\}_{j=1}^{q}$ ?
\[
IoU(S,G)=\frac{\sum\limits_{i=1}^{p}\sum\limits _{j=1}^{q}\mathcal{O}\left(s_{i},g_{j}\right)}{\Gamma_{G}}
\]
where $\Gamma_{S}=p$ and $\Gamma_{G}=q$ - number of segments in
each segmentation.

The above is not symmetric w.r.t. $S$ and $G$.

\[
IoU(S,G)=\frac{\sum\limits_{i=1}^{p}\sum\limits _{j=1}^{q}\mathcal{O}\left(s_{i},g_{j}\right)}{\Gamma_{S}\Gamma_{G}}
\]


The above would penalise two equal segmentations if they have larger
amount of segments.


\subsection{SC}

Asymmetric metric, therefore two possible uses:


\subsubsection{Covering of the Test Segmentation with the Ground Truths}

\[
C\left(\left\{{G_{i}}\right\}_{i=1}^{M}\longrightarrow S\right)=\frac{1}{M}\sum\limits_{i=1}^{M}\frac{1}{N}\sum\limits_{s\in S}\left|s\right|\max_{g\in G_{i}}\frac{\left|s\cap g\right|}{\left|s\cup g\right|}
\]


where $N=\left|S\right|=\left|G_{i}\right|$ is number of pixels in
the image.


\subsubsection{Covering of the Ground Truths with the Test Segmentation}

\[
C\left(S\longrightarrow\left\{{G_{i}}\right\}_{i=1}^{M}\right)=\frac{1}{M}\sum\limits_{i=1}^{M}\frac{1}{N}\sum\limits_{g\in G_{i}}\left|g\right|\max_{g\in G_{i}}\frac{\left|s\cap g\right|}{\left|s\cup g\right|}
\]



\section{VPR (Volumetric Precision-Recall)}


\subsection{VPR unnormalised}

\[
\tilde{P}=\frac{1}{M}\sum\limits_{i=1}^{M}\frac{\sum\limits_{s\in\mathbb{S}}\max\limits_{g\in\mathbb{G}_{i}}\left|s\cap g\right|}{\left|\mathbb{S}\right|}
\]


\[
\tilde{R}=\sum\limits_{i=1}^{M}\frac{\sum\limits_{g\in\mathbb{G}_{i}}\max\limits_{s\in\mathbb{S}}\left|s\cap g\right|}{\sum\limits_{i=1}^{M}\left|\mathbb{G}_{i}\right|}
\]


\[
\tilde{F}=\frac{2\tilde{P}\tilde{R}}{\tilde{P}+\tilde{R}}
\]


where $\mathbb{S}$ and $\{\mathbb{G}_{i}\}_{i=1}^{M}$ are segmentations,

$\cap$ computes volume overlap between segments, and 

$\left|\centerdot\right|$ counts the pixels in the voxel.


\subsection{VPR normalised (lower bound)}

\[
P=\frac{\sum\limits_{i=1}^{M}\sum\limits_{s\in\mathbb{S}}\max\limits_{g\in\mathbb{G}_{i}}\left|s\cap g\right|-\boxed{\sum\limits _{i=1}^{M}\max\limits _{g\in\mathbb{G}_{i}}\left|g\right|}}{M\left|\mathbb{S}\right|-\boxed{\sum\limits _{i=1}^{M}\max\limits _{g\in\mathbb{G}_{i}}\left|g\right|}}
\]


\[
R=\sum\limits_{i=1}^{M}\frac{\sum\limits_{g\in\mathbb{G}_{i}}\max\limits_{s\in\mathbb{S}}\left|s\cap g\right|-\boxed{\sum\limits _{i=1}^{M}\Gamma_{\mathbb{G}_{i}}}}{\sum\limits_{i=1}^{M}\left|\mathbb{G}_{i}\right|-\boxed{\sum\limits _{i=1}^{M}\Gamma_{\mathbb{G}_{i}}}}
\]


\[
F=\frac{2PR}{P+R}
\]



\subsection{VPR normalised (new - according to model capacity of test segmentation)}

\[
\hat{P}=\frac{\sum\limits_{i=1}^{M}\sum\limits_{s\in\mathbb{S}}\max\limits_{g\in\mathbb{G}_{i}}\left|s\cap g\right|-\boxed{M\Gamma_{\mathbb{S}}}}{M\left|\mathbb{S}\right|-\boxed{M\Gamma_{\mathbb{S}}}}
\]


\[
\hat{{R}}=\sum\limits_{i=1}^{M}\frac{\sum\limits_{g\in\mathbb{G}_{i}}\max\limits_{s\in\mathbb{S}}\left|s\cap g\right|-\boxed{M\max_{s\in\mathbb{S}}\left|s\right|}}{\sum\limits_{i=1}^{M}\left|\mathbb{G}_{i}\right|-\boxed{M\max_{s\in\mathbb{S}}\left|s\right|}}
\]


\[
\hat{{F}}=\frac{2\hat{P}\hat{R}}{\hat{P}+\hat{R}}
\]

\end{document}
